alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 17 at 3:55AM AKST until February 17 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. East winds gusting 20 to 35 mph, highest through Portage Valley. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound, including the Seward Highway corridor from eastern Turnagain Arm to Seward. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected in early this morning. Winds will diminish by mid morning, then shift to the west by midday. Light snow will linger through midday then taper off this afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
